Tom still doesn't understand.
Tom suddenly stopped talking.
Tom talked to Mary yesterday.
Marathi: Tom a parlé à Mary hier.

English: Tom thought Mary could do it.
Marathi: Tom pensait que Mary pourrait le faire.

English: Tom thought Mary was kidding.
Tom told Mary to stop eating.
Marathi: Tom a dit à Mary d'arrêter de manger.

English: Tom told them not to do that.
Marathi: Tom leur a dit de ne pas faire ça.

English: Tom told us to take our time.
Marathi: Tom nous a dit de prendre notre temps.

English: Tom vanished without a trace.
Marathi: Tom disparut sans laisser de traces.

English: Tom waited more than an hour.
Marathi: Tom a attendu plus d'une heure.

English: Tom walked across the street.
Tom wanted to see Mary happy.
Tom wanted to stop and think.
Tom wanted to tell the truth.
Tom wanted to wash his hands.
Marathi: Tom voulait se laver les mains.

English: Tom wants this room spotless.
Tom wants to become a priest.
Tom wants to go to Australia.
Tom wants to go to the beach.
Marathi: Tom veut aller à la plage.

English: Tom was dressed all in black.
Marathi: Tom était habillé tout en noir.

English: Tom was hiding behind a tree.
Marathi: Tom se cachait derrière un arbre.

English: Tom was in Boston last month.
Marathi: Tom était à Boston le mois dernier.

English: Tom was like a brother to me.
Marathi: Tom était comme un frère pour moi.

English: Tom was stabbed in the chest.
Marathi: Tom a été poignardé dans la poitrine.

English: Tom was the one who found me.
Marathi: Tom fut celui qui me trouva.

English: Tom was wearing a brown coat.
Tom wasn't at Mary's funeral.
Marathi: Tom n'était pas à l'enterrement de Mary.

English: Tom wasn't thinking straight.
Marathi: Tom n'avait pas les idées en place.

English: Tom went back to his bedroom.
Tom went into the room first.
Marathi: Tom entra dans la pièce en premier.

English: Tom went to church with Mary.
Marathi: Tom est allé à l'église avec Marie.

English: Tom will make a good teacher.
Tom will never agree to that.
Tom will pay for what he did.
Marathi: Tom paiera pour ce qu'il a fait.

English: Tom won a large sum of money.
Marathi: Tom a gagné une grosse somme d'argent.

English: Tom won't be back for a week.
Marathi: Tom ne reviendra pas avant une semaine.

English: Tom won't bother you anymore.
Tom's behavior infuriated me.
Marathi: Le comportement de Tom m'a rendue furieuse.

English: Tom's birthday was yesterday.
Tom's body has been cremated.
Marathi: Le corps de Tom a été incinéré.

English: Tom's boss is very demanding.
Marathi: Le patron de Tom est très exigeant.

English: Tom's eyelids were half open.
Marathi: Les paupières de Tom étaient à moitié ouvertes.

English: Tom's father is an alcoholic.
Marathi: Le père de Tom est alcoolique.

English: Tom's response was immediate.
Marathi: La réponse de Tom fut immédiate.

English: Tomorrow will be another day.
Too many sweets make you fat.
Traveling is easy these days.
Marathi: Voyager est facile, de nos jours.

English: True friendship is priceless.
Turn down the volume, please.
Marathi: Baissez le volume, je vous prie.

English: Turn left at the first light.
Marathi: Tournez à gauche au premier feu.

English: Turn left at the next corner.
Marathi: Tourne à gauche au coin suivant.

English: Turn the radio down a little.
Twenty people died in a fire.
Marathi: Vingt personnes sont mortes dans un incendie.

English: Two cars were in an accident.
Marathi: Deux voitures ont été impliquées dans un accident.

English: Variety is the spice of life.
Marathi: La diversité est le piment de la vie.

English: Visiting Tom was a good idea.
Marathi: Rendre visite à Tom était une bonne idée.

English: Wait here till he comes back.
Marathi: Attendez ici jusqu'à ce qu'il revienne.

English: Wait here. I'll be back soon.
Wait. I can't walk that fast.
Marathi: Attendez. Je ne peux pas marcher aussi vite.

English: Was he in Hokkaido last year?
Was there a book on the desk?
Marathi: Y avait-il un livre sur le bureau ?

English: Was there anyone else around?
Marathi: Y avait-il qui que ce soit d'autre aux alentours ?

English: Was this man threatening you?
Wash your hands before meals.
Marathi: Lavez-vous les mains avant les repas.

English: Watch out, the man has a gun.
We actually saw the accident.
We all need to stay together.
Marathi: Nous avons tous besoin de rester unis.

English: We all need to work together.
Marathi: Nous avons tous besoin de travailler ensemble.

English: We appreciate your hard work.
We are going to have a storm.
We are in favor of your plan.
Marathi: Nous sommes en faveur de votre plan.

English: We are liable for the damage.
Marathi: Nous sommes responsables en cas de dégâts.

English: We are not going on vacation.
We arrived there before noon.
We booked seats for the play.
Marathi: Nous avons réservé les places pour la pièce de théâtre.

English: We both know Tom is innocent.
Marathi: Nous savons tous les deux que Tom est innocent.

English: We both want to go to Boston.
Marathi: Nous voulons tous deux nous rendre à Boston.

English: We can rely on his judgement.
Marathi: Aamhi tyacha judgement var bharosa thevu shakto.

English: We can't do this without you.
Marathi: Aamhi he tumchya vinay nahi karu shakto.

English: We can't ignore this problem.
Marathi: Aamhi hi samasya ignore karu shakto nahi.

English: We can't live without oxygen.
Marathi: Aamhi oxygen vinay jeevan ghet nahi.

English: We can't trust what she says.
Marathi: Aamhi ti je mhanate te vishwas karu shakto nahi.

English: We can't waste even a minute.
Marathi: Aamhi ek minute hi vyarth ghalu shakto nahi.

English: We charge a commission of 3%.
We crossed the river by boat.
Marathi: Aamhi nadi par boat varun cross kela.

English: We did nothing in particular.
We didn't get paid this week.
Marathi: Aamhala ya hapte bhugtan nahi zhalay.

English: We didn't give them a choice.
Marathi: Aamhi tyanna ek option nahi dilay.

English: We don't have any bread left.
Marathi: Aamchya kade kahi bread nahi raahila.

English: We don't have much in common.
Marathi: Aamchya madhe khup samanya nahi aahe.

English: We don't have much more time.
Marathi: Aamchya kade aajun khup vel nahi aahe.

English: We don't have this in Europe.
Marathi: Aamchya kade he Europe madhe nahi aahe.

English: We don't have time to debate.
Marathi: Aamchya kade charcha karayla vel nahi aahe.

English: We don't know the answer yet.
We found all the boxes empty.
We found the boy fast asleep.
Marathi: Aamhi mulga khup gahrat suta milala.

English: We go to see her twice a day.
Marathi: Aamhi tichya kade divasat don vel jau.

English: We got caught in a rainstorm.
We got to the station at six.
Marathi: Aamhi chha vaje station var zhalu.

English: We had better not mention it.
We have a colleague in Spain.
Marathi: Aamchya kade Spain madhe ek sahyogi aahe.

English: We have an open relationship.
Marathi: Aamchya kade ek open sambandh aahe.

English: We have little time to waste.
Marathi: Aamchya kade khup vel nahi aahe.

English: We have precious little time.
Marathi: Aamchya kade khup kami vel aahe.

English: We have the opposite problem.
We have to give Tom a chance.
Marathi: Aamhala Tom la ek avsar dene aahe.

English: We lead a very ordinary life.
Marathi: Aamhi khup sadharan jeevan ghet aahe.

English: We listened to the bell ring.
We live close to the station.
We live far from the airport.
Marathi: Aamhi airport kade khup dur rahato.

English: We live in the United States.
We may as well start at once.
Marathi: Aamhi veglya veglya suru karu shakto.

English: We might be able to help her.
We must conform to the rules.
We should follow his example.
We should get more organized.
We should love our neighbors.
Marathi: Aamhi aaplya padhyavarchya prem karayla paaije.

English: We should tell Tom the truth.
Marathi: Aamhi Tom la satya sangayla paaije.

English: We should've stayed with Tom.
We still have plenty of time.
We talked about it all night.
Marathi: Aamhi raat bhar tyavar bolat rahalo.

English: We took shelter under a tree.
We traveled around Australia.
We usually talked in English.
Marathi: Aamhi sarvada English madhe bolat hota.

English: We waited for him to turn up.
We walked ten miles that day.
We want you to sing the song.
Marathi: Aamhi tumhala he geet ghalayla ichhito.

English: We went on a picnic together.
We went to the beach to swim.
We were at a loss what to do.
Marathi: Aamhi kay karaycha te mahiti nahi hota.

English: We were born on the same day.
We were up all night talking.
We weren't talking about you.
We will be living in England.
We will make up for the loss.
We work every day but Sunday.
We work from dawn until dusk.
We'd do anything to help you.
Marathi: Aamhi tumhala madat karayla kahi hi karu shakto.

English: We'd like you to sing a song.
Marathi: Aamhi tumhala ek geet ghalayla ichhito.

English: We'll accept your conditions.
We'll all be dead eventually.
Marathi: Aamhi sarv lok ek divas maru shakto.

English: We'll be back here next week.
Marathi: Aamhi pudhcha hapta ithe parat yeu.

English: We'll be back on air shortly.
Marathi: Aamhi jald punha on air yeu.

English: We'll have to take that risk.
We'll pick Tom up on the way.
Marathi: Aamhi rasta madhe Tom la ghyu.

English: We'll sort this out tomorrow.
We'll talk about it tomorrow.
We're all together right now.
We're better off without you.
Marathi: Aamhi tumchyasathi rahun khup chhan aahe.

English: We're going to be aggressive.
We're going to be late again.
We're going to eat right now.
We're going to work together.
We're missing something here.
We're not in the 80s anymore.
We're the best at what we do.
Marathi: Aamhi je karato te khup chhan aahe.

English: We're totally cool with that.
We're very satisfied with it.
We've been talking about you.
We've been working all night.
We've got a mystery to solve.
Marathi: Aamchya kade ek rahasya suljhavayla aahe.

English: We've had a very hard winter.
Marathi: Aamchya kade khup kathin shita aahe.

English: We've only got three minutes.
Marathi: Aamchya kade fakta teen minute aahet.

English: We've run enough for one day.
Marathi: Aamchya kade ek divas sathi khup chalavla aahe.

English: Were you at home all morning?
Marathi: Tu kal savar gharat hotas ka?

English: Were you looking at her legs?
Marathi: Tu tichya jamba kade baghitla ka?

English: What Tom did was very stupid.
Marathi: Tom ne je kele te khup moorkhapan hota.

English: What are my responsibilities?
What are the neighbors doing?
What are you trying to imply?
What are you trying to prove?
Marathi: Tu kay pramanit karaycha prayatna kartoy?

English: What are you wearing tonight?
Marathi: Tu aaj raat kay ghalaycha aahe?

English: What do I want to talk about?
What do they call their baby?
What do those lights signify?
What do you call your mother?
Marathi: Tu tichya aai la kay mhanat?

English: What do you expect to happen?
What do you feel like eating?
What do you have in your bag?

We should get more organized.
We should love our neighbors.

What do those lights signify?
What do you call your mother?
Marathi: Tu tichya aai la kay mhanat?

English: What do you expect to happen?
What do you feel like eating?
What do you have in your bag?
When can I see you next time?
Marathi: Tu pudhcha vel kiti bhetu shakto?

English: When did you finish the work?
When do you want me to start?
Marathi: Tu mala kay suru karaycha aahe?

English: When is your book coming out?
When is your school festival?
Marathi: Tichya school cha utsav kadhi aahe?

English: When shall I return the book?
When should I return the car?
When will we arrive in Tokyo?
When will you come back home?
When would you like to begin?
Where are your friends going?
Where can I buy a live tiger?
Marathi: Mi jivant tiger kuthe ghetu shakto?

English: Where can I do some shopping?
Where can I leave my bicycle?
Marathi: Mi majha cycle kuthe thevu shakto?

English: Where did all this come from?
Where did you buy that shirt?
Where did you go last Sunday?
Where did you learn all that?
Where did you learn to shoot?
Where did you see that woman?
Where do you think I met her?
Marathi: Tu kay vichartay ki mi tichya kade kuthe pahila?

English: Where do you want to go, sir?
Where have you been all week?
Where is the Chinese embassy?
Where was this picture taken?
Where would you like to live?
Where's the closest bus stop?
Marathi: Sarvat javalacha bus stop kuthe aahe?

English: Which bed do you want to use?
Which credit cards can I use?
Marathi: Mi kontya credit cards vapru shakto?

English: Which hat do you want to buy?
Which of you came here first?
Who am I supposed to go with?
Who are we competing against?
Who are your closest friends?
Marathi: Tujhe khup javalache mitra konta aahet?

English: Who designed the White House?
Who did you give the book to?
Marathi: Tu te pustak kashya la dila?

English: Who do you think that man is?
Marathi: Tu kay vichartay ki he manus kon aahe?

English: Who invited Tom to the party?
Marathi: Tom la party la kashne bulavla?

English: Who wants some hot chocolate?
Who will look after the baby?
Who's been eating my peanuts?
Who's playing hockey tonight?
What do you make of all this?
What do you say we go skiing?
Marathi: Tu kay mhantay ki aapan skiing la jau?

English: What do you think they'll do?
Marathi: Te kay karu shakto asay tujhya vicharat?

English: What do you want to do today?
What does silence sound like?
What does that mean, exactly?
What does this remind you of?
What does this sentence mean?
What don't you want me to do?
What exactly am I paying for?
Marathi: Mi exactly kay sathi bhugtan karto?

English: What flower do you like best?
What happened here yesterday?
What happens if that happens?
What if something goes wrong?
What is it you want me to do?
What is the capital of Haiti?
What is the good of doing it?
What is the speed limit here?
What line of work are you in?
What other choice do we have?
Marathi: Aamchya kade dusra kay option aahe?

English: What she said made him angry.
Marathi: Tine je mhanla te tyala krodhit kela.

English: What she says sounds strange.
Marathi: Tine je mhanate te ajeeb vatate.

English: What time do you have supper?
Marathi: Tu kiti vaje supper ghalaycha aahe?

English: What time does the club open?
What was served at the party?
What were you dreaming about?
What were you thinking about?
What will the newspapers say?
What would you do without me?
What would you like me to do?
What would you like to drink?
What would your father think?
What'll we do if Tom is late?
Marathi: Tom tard zhalay tar aamhi kay karu?

English: What're you doing about this?
Marathi: Tu he vishay kay karat aahe?

English: What time does the club open?
Will you please come with me?
Marathi: Tu majhya sobat yeu shakto ka?

English: Will you sell your car to me?
Marathi: Tu majhya sathi tichi car vikto ka?

English: Will you show me the picture?
Marathi: Tu mala te chitra dakhavshil ka?

English: Will you watch the superbowl?
Winds from the sea are humid.
Marathi: Samudratun aane wale hawa khushk aahe.

English: Windy this morning, isn't it?
Marathi: Aaj savar hawa khup aahe, nahi ka?

English: Winter is my favorite season.
Without you, I would've died.
Won't you have some more tea?
Marathi: Tu thoda jast chai nahi ghalu shakto ka?

English: Would 9 o'clock be all right?
Would you be friends with me?
Marathi: Tu majhya sobat mitra banayla ichhito ka?

English: Would you be willing to help?
Marathi: Tu madat karayla tayar aahe ka?

English: Would you come here a moment?
Marathi: Tu ek pal ithe yeu shakto ka?

English: Would you give me a discount?
Marathi: Tu mala discount dila shakto ka?

English: Would you help me if I moved?
Marathi: Tu mala madat karayla tayar aahe ka?

English: Would you like a cup of milk?
Marathi: Tu ek glass doodh ghalayla ichhito ka?

English: Would you like another apple?
Marathi: Tu ek dusra seb ghalayla ichhito ka?

English: Would you like tea or coffee?
Marathi: Tu chai ki coffee ghalayla ichhito ka?

English: Would you like to freshen up?
Marathi: Tu thoda refresh honayala ichhito ka?

English: Yes. You're absolutely right.
Yesterday I helped my father.
Marathi: Kal mi majhya babala madat keli.

English: You always were good at math.
Marathi: Tu hamesha ganit madhe chhan hotas.

English: You and I are going together.
You and I have the same idea.
Marathi: Tu ani mi ekach vichar ahe.

English: You are as tall as my sister.
Marathi: Tu majhya bahin kadar ucha aahe.

English: You are both pretty and kind.
Marathi: Tu donhi sundar ani dayalu aahe.

English: You are busy now, aren't you?
Marathi: Tu aata busy aahe, nahi ka?

English: You are not a child any more.
Marathi: Tu aata ek mulga nahi aahe.

English: You are suitable for the job.
Marathi: Tu he job sathi yogya aahe.

English: You aren't busy now, are you?
Marathi: Tu aata busy nahi aahe, nahi ka?

English: You can be anything you want.
You can count on me any time.
Marathi: Tu kadhi hi mala bharosa thevu shakto.

English: You can do whatever you like.
You can easily find the bank.
Marathi: Tu bank khup sope ghetu shakto.

English: You can go anyplace you like.
You can go wherever you want.
You can sit down if you want.
Marathi: Tu basu shakto jar tu ichhit asel tar.

English: You can't cancel the meeting.
Marathi: Tu meeting cancel karu shakto nahi.

English: You can't carry on like this.
You can't control everything.
Marathi: Tu sarva kahi control karu shakto nahi.

English: You can't keep this a secret.
Marathi: Tu he secret ghalu shakto nahi.

English: You can't know that for sure.
Marathi: Tu he khup nishchit nahi mahiti.

English: You can't live without water.
Marathi: Tu paanyas vinay jeevan ghet nahi.

English: You can't park your car here.
Marathi: Tu ithe tichi car park karu shakto nahi.

English: I want to learn how to play the accordion.
She is studying to become an engineer.
I am a student at Hyogo University.
Marathi: Mi Hyogo University la student ahe.

English: I am able to swim across the river.
I am about as big as my father now.
Marathi: Ata mi majha vadil kadar motha ahe.

English: I am accustomed to staying up late.
Marathi: Mi der raat pale rahanyala accustomed ahe.

English: I am afraid he will make a mistake.
Marathi: Mala bhay ahe ki to chuk karel.

English: I am afraid that he might get hurt.
Marathi: Mala bhay ahe ki to jar hurt hoil.

English: I am afraid that you will get lost.
Marathi: Mala bhay ahe ki tumhi gadapnaar.

English: I am afraid to jump over the ditch.
Marathi: Mala fosat par sautanyat bhay ahe.

English: I am convinced that he is innocent.
Marathi: Mi vishwas kartoy ki to innocent ahe.

English: I am determined to give up smoking.
Marathi: Mi smoking chha tyaag karayla nishchit ahe.

English: I am doubtful whether he will come.
Marathi: Mala shanka ahe ki to yeil ki nahi.

English: I am going to leave my present job.
Marathi: Mi majha haala chha job chhodnayacha ahe.

English: I am going to play soccer tomorrow.
I am grateful to you for your help.
Marathi: Mi tumchya madat sathi abhari ahe.

English: I am interested in taking pictures.
Marathi: Mala photo ghetya madhe interest ahe.

English: I am looking forward to seeing you.
I am lost. Can you help me, please?
Marathi: Mi gadaloy. Tumhi mala madat karu shakta ka?

English: I am married and have two children.
Marathi: Mi married ahe ani don mulay ahe.

English: I am not always at home on Sundays.
I am not rich, nor do I wish to be.
Marathi: Mi rich nahi, ani rich honyachi iccha nahi.

English: I am on good terms with my brother.
Marathi: Mi majha bhai sobat changa sambandh ahe.

English: I am repairing the washing machine.
I am so busy that I can't help you.
Marathi: Mi khup busy ahe, mhanun tumhala madat karu shakat nahi.

English: I am staying for another few weeks.
Marathi: Mi thodya aadhik weeks sathi rahnaar ahe.

English: I am sure that he is an honest man.
Marathi: Mi nishchit ahe ki to ek honest man ahe.

English: I am taking a holiday at the beach.
Marathi: Mi beach var chhutti ghet ahe.

English: I am thinking of resigning at once.
Marathi: Mi turat resignation denyacha vichar karat ahe.

English: I am unable to agree on that point.
Marathi: Mi tyas point var sahamat hou shakat nahi.

English: I am very tired from the hard work.
Marathi: Mi kathin kamavar khup thakla ahe.

English: I am waiting for the store to open.
Marathi: Mi store khulanyasathi wait karat ahe.

English: I am yawning because I feel sleepy.
Marathi: Mi yawning karat ahe karan mala jhap aali ahe.

English: I asked my teacher what to do next.
Marathi: Mi majha teacher la next kay karaycha vicharlela.

English: I ate nothing but bread and butter.
Marathi: Mi bread ani butter chya sathich khala.

English: I bought a new computer last month.
Marathi: Mi past month ek naveen computer ghitla.

English: I bought that record in this store.
Marathi: Mi he record haatla tyach store madhe.

English: I bought the car at a 10% discount.
I bought two tickets for a concert.
Marathi: Mi concert sathi don tickets ghitla.

English: I brought that back from Australia.
Marathi: Mi he Australia pasun gheun ala.

English: I buy loads of stuff at that store.
Marathi: Mi tyach store madhe loads of stuff khareedat ahe.

English: I can hardly make out what he says.
Marathi: Mi tyacha kay mhanto te hardly samjun shakat ahe.

English: I can look at it when you're ready.
Marathi: Mi tyala tumhi ready jhale ki baghun shakto.

English: I can make the time to talk to you.
Marathi: Mi tumchya sobat bolanyasathi time thevu shakto.

English: I can not bear this noise any more.
Marathi: Mi ha noise aadhik bear karu shakat nahi.

English: I can run the fastest of the three.
Marathi: Mi teenchya madhe fastest run karu shakto.

English: I can seldom find time for reading.
Marathi: Mi reading sathi rarely time shodhu shakto.

English: I can walk to school in 10 minutes.
Marathi: Mi 10 minutes madhe school la walk karu shakto.

English: I can't afford a new car this year.
Marathi: Ya varsh mi naveen car afford karu shakat nahi.

English: I can't believe I just shot myself.
Marathi: Mi vishwas karu shakat nahi ki mi aatme shot kela.

English: I can't believe it's raining again.
Marathi: Mi vishwas karu shakat nahi ki punha barasato.

English: I can't believe we finally made it.
Marathi: Mi vishwas karu shakat nahi ki aakhir karun jalyat.

English: I can't believe you eat that stuff.
Marathi: Mi vishwas karu shakat nahi ki tu ha stuff khato.

English: I can't believe you just said that.
Marathi: Mi vishwas karu shakat nahi ki tu ha shabd mhanala.

English: I can't believe you'd be so stupid.
Marathi: Mi vishwas karu shakat nahi ki tu itka stupida asu shakto.

English: I can't believe you're really here.
Marathi: Mi vishwas karu shakat nahi ki tu kharach ithe aahes.

English: I can't blame you. It was my fault.
Marathi: Mi tumhala dosh nahi dete. He majhi chuk hoti.

English: I can't decide if I'm happy or sad.
Marathi: Mi decide karu shakat nahi ki mi happy ahe ki sad.

English: I can't do without this dictionary.
Marathi: Mi ha dictionary vinna kai karu shakat nahi.

English: I can't drink coffee without sugar.
Marathi: Mi coffee sugar vinna piyu shakat nahi.

English: I can't find time to read the book.
Marathi: Mi book vachanayachi time shodhu shakat nahi.

English: I can't help you because I am busy.
Marathi: Mi tumhala madat karu shakat nahi karan mi busy ahe.

English: I can't keep looking the other way.
Marathi: Mi dusrya side bakhu shakat nahi.

English: I can't play tennis as well as Tom.
Marathi: Mi tennis Tom kadar changlya padhatine nahi khelushakat.

English: I can't put up with all that noise.
Marathi: Mi ha noise sagla bear karu shakat nahi.

English: I can't put up with her any longer.
Marathi: Mi ti la adik bear karu shakat nahi.

English: I can't put up with him any longer.
Marathi: Mi to la adik bear karu shakat nahi.

English: I can't sleep because of the noise.
Marathi: Mi noise mule jhopu shakat nahi.

English: I can't stand his behavior anymore.
Marathi: Mi tyacha behavior more stand karu shakat nahi.

English: I can't tell you how thrilled I am.
Marathi: Mi tumhala kiti thrilled ahe te sanghu shakat nahi.

English: I can't think of his name just now.
Marathi: Mi ha naam turat vicharu shakat nahi.

English: I carried the heavy bag on my back.
Marathi: Mi majhya peethavar motha bag thevli.

English: I caught sight of her in the crowd.
Marathi: Mi crowd madhe ticha drushtila ghetla.

English: I could sure use that reward money.
Marathi: Mi nishchit pane ha reward money vapru shakto.

English: I couldn't figure out how to do it.
Marathi: Mi kasa karaycha te samjun shakal nahi.

English: I hope that your brother is better.
Marathi: "Mala asha aahe ki tumcha bhau theek ahe."

English: I hope to own my own house someday.
Marathi: "Mala asha aahe ki ek divas mi mazi apni ghar thevu shakto/shakti."

English: I hope you are not catching a cold.
Marathi: "Mala asha aahe ki tumhala zukhambat nahi aaye."

English: I insist that he should go with us.
Marathi: "Mi zidd karato ki to amchyasobat jau shakat."

English: I insist that we leave immediately.
Marathi: "Mi zidd karato ki aapan turat nighuya."

English: I intend to study abroad next year.
Marathi: "Mi agamikal varsh videshat adhyan karaycha vichar karto/karti."

English: I invited my neighbor to breakfast.
Marathi: "Mi majhya padkya la nashta sathi nimantran dile."

English: I just banged my head on something.
Marathi: "Mi fakta kahi vastu var mastak takla."

English: I just changed my mind. That's all.
I just couldn't go through with it.
Marathi: "Mi fakta te purvaycha shakt nahi hota."

English: I just decided I'd come home early.
Marathi: "Mi fakta decide keli ki mi pudhe ghari early yenu."

English: I just did what they told me to do.
Marathi: "Mi fakta te kele je te mala sangitla hota."

English: I just did what you asked me to do.
Marathi: "Mi fakta te kele je tumhi mala vicharlela hota."

English: I just didn't feel like getting up.

English: I looked for him in the supermarket.
I looked, but I didn't see anything.
Marathi: Mi baghitla, pan kahi disla nahi.

English: I lost my key somewhere around here.
Marathi: Mi majhi key ekhadi jagah var ghalali.

English: I lost my purse on my way to school.
Marathi: Mi school la jatana majha purse ghalala.

English: I loved that movie when I was a kid.

English: I made several mistakes in the exam.
Marathi: Mi exam madhe kayi chukha keli.

English: I made sure no one was following me.
Marathi: Mi check kela ki koi pan mala follow kart nahi.

English: I managed to make him understand it.
Marathi: Mi tyala samjun ghene saathi madat keli.

English: I may have seen that girl somewhere.

English: I may know someone who can help you.

English: I met her on the street by accident.

English: I might be drunk, but I'm not crazy.
Marathi: Mi madak asu shakto, pan mi pagal nahi.

English: I missed the last train last Friday.
Marathi: Mi last Friday last train chukali.

English: I need a hacksaw to finish this job.
Marathi: Mi ha job purta karayla ek hacksaw havi ahe.

English: I need a new broom. This one's shot.

English: I need someone who can speak French.

English: I need thread to sew on this button.
Marathi: Mi ya button sath thread havi ahe.

English: I never have had occasion to use it.

English: I never have trouble falling asleep.

English: I never imagined anything like this.
Marathi: Mi asha goshti kadi imagine keli nahi.

English: I never imagined he'd do that to me.
Marathi: Mi kadhi nahi imagine keli ki to mala asa karil.

English: I never let anyone else feed my dog.
Marathi: Mi kadhi pan anya loka la majha dog feed karaycha nahi dile.

English: I never really gave it much thought.
Marathi: Mi kadhi itka vichar kela nahi.

English: I never said this job would be easy.
Marathi: Mi kadhi nahi mhantle ki ha job easy asel.

English: I never thought you really did that.

English: I no longer have the energy to talk.
I no longer wish to be your husband.

English: I object to being treated like that.
Marathi: Mi ashe treatment detana nafarat karto.

English: I only quit because you asked me to.
Marathi: Mi fakta tumhi mala request keli mhanun stop kela.

English: I opened the drawer to get a pencil.
Marathi: Mi ek pencil ghyayla drawer open keli.

English: I ordered this swimsuit from France.
Marathi: Mi ha swimsuit France madhun order kela.

English: I overslept so I was late to school.

English: I owe what I am today to my parents.
Marathi: Mi aaj je ahe te majha parents la owe karto.

English: I paid him on the spot for his work.
Marathi: Mi tyala tyachya work sathi immediately pay kela.

English: I persuaded him to consult a doctor.
Marathi: Mi tyala doctor la consult karayla manavla.

English: I persuaded him to give up the idea.
I probably shouldn't have done that.
Marathi: Mi probably te karaycha nahi hota.

English: I reached Nagoya early this morning.
Marathi: Mi aaj sagla sahkal Nagoya la reach zhalay.

English: I read the book from cover to cover.
Marathi: Mi book cover pasun cover paryant okhlela.

English: I really don't recommend that today.
Marathi: Mi aaj te recommend nahi karto.

English: I really feel like crying right now.

English: I really have to finish my homework.
Marathi: Mi aata really majhe homework finish karaycha ahe.

English: I really need to be alone right now.
Marathi: Mi aata really alone rahaycha ahe.

English: I really want to get this work done.
Marathi: Mi ha work complete karaycha ahe.

English: I really wish I knew how to do that.
Marathi: Mi really wish karto ki te kasa karayche te mahit asht.

English: I regret having neglected my health.
Marathi: Mi majhi health neglect kelichi regret karto.

English: I regret not having kept my promise.
Marathi: Mi promise nahi thevle te regret karto.

English: I regret saying that you were wrong.
Marathi: Mi tu wrong hota ase mhantle te regret karto.

English: I regret that I did not work harder.
Marathi: Mi harder work nahi kela te regret karto.

English: I remember hearing this tune before.

English: I remember seeing you all somewhere.
Marathi: Mi tumhala sagla kahi jagah pahile.

English: I saw Tom dancing with another girl.
Marathi: Mi Tom la dusrya mulgi barobar nachat astana pahile.

English: I saw an old woman cross the street.
Marathi: Mi ek old woman la street cross karat pahile.

English: I saw him walking alone in the park.
Marathi: Mi tyala park madhe ekta walk kartana pahile.

English: I saw the man knocked down by a car.

English: I should get to Boston by lunchtime.
Marathi: Mi lunchtime paryant Boston la pahunchayla havay.

English: I should go home and get some sleep.
Marathi: Mi gharat jauun thoda rest ghyayla hava.

English: I should probably not be doing this.
I should've done that, but I didn't.
Marathi: Mi te kela pahije hota, pan nahi kela.

English: I should've expected that to happen.
Marathi: Mi te hote ki te hone pahije hota.

English: I shouldn't have gotten up so early.
I spent last Sunday reading a novel.
Marathi: Mi pichla Sunday novel vachane spend kela.

English: I spent the weekend with my friends.
Marathi: Mi weekend majhya friends barobar ghalawla.

English: I spent two hours playing the piano.
Marathi: Mi don ghante piano vagayla spend kela.

English: I spilled coffee on your tablecloth.
Marathi: Mi tumchya tablecloth var coffee vachawla.

English: I stayed at home because I was sick.
Marathi: Mi gharat rahlay karan mi sick hota.

English: I steered clear of sensitive topics.
I still have a lot of pages to read.
Marathi: Mi ajun khup pages vachayache ahe.

English: I still say we should've helped Tom.
Marathi: Mi ajun hi mhanto ki aplya Tom la madat keli pahije hota.

English: I studied hard when I was in school.
Marathi: Mi school madhe hard study kela.

English: I suppose everyone thinks I'm crazy.
Marathi: Mi suppose karto ki sagle mala pagal samjat ahet.

English: I suppose you want to use my office.
Marathi: Mi suppose karto ki tumhi majha office vaprayla iccha ahe.

English: I take it that we are to come early.
Marathi: Mi assume karto ki aapan early yeu.

English: I talked him into selling his house.
Marathi: Mi tyala tyachi house sell karayla manavla.

English: I taught Tom French for three years.
Marathi: Mi Tom la teen varsh French shikawla.

English: I taught my girlfriend how to drive.
Marathi: Mi majhi girlfriend la drive karnar shikawla.

English: I think I'm in trouble with my wife.
Marathi: Mi vichar karto ki mi majhi wife barobar trouble madhe ahe.

English: I think I've seen this movie before.
Marathi: Mi vichar karto ki mi ha movie agodi pahila ahe.

English: I think Tom could make a difference.
Marathi: Mi vichar karto ki Tom difference karu shakto.

English: I think Tom needs medical attention.
Marathi: Mi vichar karto ki Tom la medical attention lagel.

English: I think Tom said he was from Boston.
Marathi: Mi vichar karto ki Tom ne Boston pasun ahe mhantla.

English: I think it's going to be a nice day.
Marathi: Mi vichar karto ki ajcha divas changa asel.

English: I think it's sad to have no friends.
Marathi: Mi vichar karto ki friends na honyachi sad ahe.

English: I think it's time for me to move on.
Marathi: Mi vichar karto ki move on karaycha vel ahe.

English: I think perhaps you should call Tom.
Marathi: Mi vichar karto ki kiva tumhi Tom la call karaycha havay.

English: I think that fact is very important.
Marathi: Mi vichar karto ki te fact khup important ahe.

English: I think that recording is important.
Marathi: Mi vichar karto ki recording important ahe.

English: I think we should do this together.
Marathi: Mi vichar karto ki aapan he sagla milun karayche.

English: I thought I heard you say something.
Marathi: Mi vichar kela ki mi tumhala kahi mhantay asay aiku.

English: I thought I saw her at the party.
Marathi: Mi vichar kela ki mi tyala party madhe pahile.

English: I thought Tom might be in trouble.
Marathi: Mi vichar kela ki Tom trouble madhe asu shakto.

English: I told Tom not to be late.
Marathi: Mi Tom la late honayacha nahi mhantla.

English: I took a deep breath before speaking.
Marathi: Mi bolaycha aadi ek deep breath ghetla.

English: I took my time to finish the work.
Marathi: Mi work complete karayla samay ghetla.

English: I understand your point of view.
Marathi: Mi tumchya point of view samjun ghetla.

English: I understand why he did that.

English: I used to live in Tokyo.
I used to like her a lot.

English: I want a knife to cut the rope with.
Marathi: Mi rope cut karayla ek knife havi ahe.

English: I want to go back to the way it was.
Marathi: Mi jase hota te jave aichha ahe.

English: I want to know exactly what you did.
Marathi: Mi exactly tumhi kay kela te mahit karaycha ahe.

English: I wish nothing but the best for you.

English: I will wait for you at the bus stop.
Marathi: Mi bus stop var tumcha wait karen.

English: I wouldn't touch that if I were you.
Marathi: Mi tumhi ashtay tar te touch nahi kela.

Marathi: Mi tumhala kahi questions vicharayla iccha karto.

English: I don't pretend to understand women.

English: I don't really know what that means.

English: I don't really know what this means.

English: I don't remember any of their names.

English: I don't think I can walk any faster.

English: I don't understand what Tom told us.

English: I don't understand what's happening.

English: I don't want to do that without you.

I don't want to hear about it again.

Marathi: "Mi 10 dollars pasun adhik spend nahi karaycha."

English: I doubt Tom really needs to do that.

English: I doubt there's anyone following me.

I expect he'll pass the examination.
Marathi: "Mi apeksha karto ki to examination pass karil."

Marathi: "Mi tuzya party vadhaun dilyamule kharab feel karto."

English: I find it difficult to believe that.
I found that restaurant by accident.

Marathi: "Mi guess karto ki mi clear naahi kelela."

English: I had hoped we might become friends.

English: I had my licence renewed a week ago.

Marathi: "Mi naahi idea hota ki tu aashik hoti."

Marathi: "Mi kiche problems hoti ja raha hoti."

Marathi: "Mi gardener ne kahi trees plant kele."

Marathi: "Mi nahi intention hoti ki hiya purvi stay karu."

Marathi: "Mala Tokyo la round trip ticket ahe."

English: I have kept a diary for three years.
Marathi: "Mi teen varsh purvi ek diary thevli aahe."

Marathi: "Mi te case barobar kashich nahi ahe."

Marathi: "Mi te kahani kahi book madhe vhalay."

Marathi: "Mala ek vastu ahe ji mi tumhala sangaychi aahe."

English: I hope it will stop raining soon.
Marathi: "Mi aasha karto ki jaldi rain bandh hoil."

English: I hope she gets better soon.
Marathi: "Mi aasha karto ki ti soon bhetayil."

English: I hope they will be here soon.
Marathi: "Mi aasha karto ki te soon ithe asel."

English: I hope you get well very soon.
Marathi: "Mi aasha karto ki tu very soon theek hoil."

English: I like the new jacket you bought.
Marathi: "Mi tula new jacket je tu buy kela te aavadate."

English: I like this one better than that one.
Marathi: "Mi he te koni better ahe te aavadate."

English: I like your dress very much.

Marathi: "Mi maza way gavala ani madat magavi lagli."

English: I made a mistake and lost my ticket.
Marathi: "Mi ek mistake keli ani maza ticket gavlo."

English: I mean to say that I love you.
Marathi: "Mi sangaycha aahe ki mi tujha prem karto."

English: I might go to the concert with Tom.
Marathi: "Mi Tom barobar concert la jaayla shakte."

English: I must get used to this new place.
Marathi: "Mi ya navi sthalachi aadat ghyavi lagel."

English: I must make a phone call to Tom.
Marathi: "Mi Tom la phone call karavi lagel."

English: I must have been mistaken about that.

Marathi: "Mi kahi divas work chya chutti ghyavi lagel."

English: I need to take a rest this afternoon.

Marathi: "Mi notice kela ki ti khup sad hoti."

Marathi: "Mi fkt ekach prashna ask karaycha ahe."

English: I remember him saying something about it.
Marathi: "Mi tyala te vishay kahi sangato smarato."

Marathi: "Mi tichya kahi other place var pahun shikla."

English: I saw Tom walk into the building.
Marathi: "Mi Tom building madhe walk karato disla."

English: I see you're busy. I'll call you back.
Marathi: "Mi baghto ki tu busy aahes. Mi parat call karen."

Marathi: "Mi ya pehle yaa vishay mahit hota."

Marathi: "Mi tanna madat karne mazy uttarachi zimiwaryt ghetli."

English: I try to avoid talking to strangers.

Marathi: "Mi samajto ki tu kasa feel karto."

English: I use public transportation every day.

English: I want a cup of coffee with cream.

English: I want to be alone for a while.
I want to get this done as soon as possible.

I was afraid I would be too late.
Marathi: "Mi bhaykali ki mi khup late hoil."

English: I was amazed by his performance.

Marathi: "Mi ya nagar madhe janlela ahe ani vadlela ahe."

English: I was cold and wanted to warm up.
Marathi: "Mi thanda hota ani warm up karayla ahe."

English: I was disappointed with the outcome.
I was eating dinner when the phone rang.
Marathi: "Phone rang jhalya var mi dinner karto hota."

English: I was excited about the new project.
I was glad to hear the good news.
Marathi: "Mi chaan news aike ahe anandita zala."

English: I was interested in buying that car.

I was pleased with the result.
I was surprised by her quick response.
Marathi: "Ti chukli ki her response quick hoti."

English: I went to the doctor for a check-up.
I went to the store to buy some milk.
Marathi: "Mi kahi milk buy karayla store la gela."

English: I went to the theater to see a play.
Marathi: "Mi ek play baghayla theater la gela."

English: I will call you when I arrive.
Marathi: "Mi arrive zhalya var tujha call karen."

English: I will come to your party if I can.
I will help you with that problem.
Marathi: "Mi tula te problem madhe madat karen."

English: I will not be able to attend the meeting.
I will take care of that for you.
I will tell you everything you need to know.

Marathi: "Mi wish karto ki tu view baghitla asel."

English: I would love to visit you this summer.
Marathi: "Mi this summer tujha visit karayla aayishkarya."

English: I would like to know more about that.
Marathi: "Mi tya vishay chi adhik mahiti ghyayla iccha karto."

English: I'd appreciate your help with this.
I'd better get going or I'll be late.
Marathi: "Mi better get going nahi tar late hoil."

English: I'd like to see that new movie.

English: I'd like to speak to the manager.
I'll bring it over to your house.
I'll call you when I get there.

Marathi: "Mi as soon as mi karu shakto tula call karen."

English: I'll let you know if I find anything.

I'll need a few minutes to get ready.
Marathi: "Mi ready honya sathi thodi minute lagel."

English: I'll pay for this, don't worry.

Marathi: "Mi ek solution shodho ka nahi baghen."

English: I'll take that into consideration.
I'll talk to Tom about it tomorrow.
Marathi: "Mi tom barobar itar vichar karnar ahe."

English: I'll try to finish it by tomorrow.
Marathi: "Mi tomorrow paryant ithe finish karayla prayatna karen."

English: I'll visit you as soon as possible.
Marathi: "Mi as soon as possible tujha visit karen."

English: I'll work on it over the weekend.
I'll write it down so I won't forget.
Marathi: "Mi te down lihun thevlen ki visrato nahi."

English: I'd like to go to the concert tonight.
Marathi: "Mi tonight concert la go karayla aayishkarya karto."

English: I'd prefer a quiet room if possible.

English: I'd suggest talking to Tom about it.
Marathi: "Mi Tom barobar he vicharayla suggest karto."

English: I'll call you as soon as I arrive.
Marathi: "Mi arrive zhalya var tula call karen."

Marathi: "Mi aathavik maza schedule check karayla lagel."

English: I'll take a look at it later.

Marathi: Mi tumchya dantanchi X-ray karnar ahe.

English: I'll tell him so when he comes here.
